intro: Pediomelum ockendonii, commonly known as the Ockendon's pediomelum, is a rare and endemic plant species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pediomelum ockendonii is considered a vulnerable species.
